alert.note: Alert for Morris (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 14 at 4:29PM EDT until April 14 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 500 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL MORRIS COUNTY... At 429 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Morris Plains, or near Morristown, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Morristown, Dover, East Hanover, Lincoln Park, Kinnelon, Boonton, Butler, Wharton, Rockaway, Morris Plains, Mendham, Mountain Lakes, Riverdale, Victory Gardens, Succasunna, Succasunna-Kenvil, Parsippany, Pequannock Township, White Meadow Lake and Hanover Township. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 35 and 48. Interstate 287 in New Jersey between mile markers 36 and 54. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
